document_title: Nasopharyngeal cancer: Causes, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_name: ung-thu-vom-hong.json_8_What should you eat and what should you avoid when diagnosed with the disease?
subsection_content:
A balanced diet is one that provides enough nutrition at the right time. The ingredients we need to provide are:
Carbohydrates (starch): Bread, potatoes, rice, noodles, vermicelli... are foods in the starch group, providing energy for muscles and brain.; Protein: found in fish and seafood, lean meat, poultry, eggs, beans, nuts...; They provide amino acids, build and develop muscle cells, skin and hair cells, nerve cells...; Lipids (fats): This is an indispensable component for the immune system, brain and many other organs. A balanced diet requires adequate saturated fats, unsaturated fats and cooking oils. All types of meat are rich sources of saturated fat. Unsaturated fats are found in oily fish (tuna, salmon, mackerel, herring...) and good oils for cancer patients include fish oil, soybean oil, sesame oil, sunflower oil. positive…; Fruits and vegetables: provide us with fiber, vitamins, minerals, antioxidants and fluids.; Milk and dairy products (cheese, butter, whey...): considered a mixture of protein, fat and carbohydrates. You should choose low-fat or skim milk, no/low sugar.; Water: Besides consuming nutritious foods, cancer patients need to supplement 1.5 - 2 liters of water per day, which can be filtered water, pure fruit juice, smoothies...
A diet is considered balanced when all of the above ingredients are used at the right time, in the right amount and with the right frequency.
Patients with nasopharyngeal cancer often experience effects before treatment (caused by the disease), during treatment (due to immediate side effects) and after stopping treatment (due to lasting side effects). . Good nutrition will help patients have good health to overcome the treatment period, as well as quickly recover after treatment. Some common side effects are dry mouth, changes in taste or difficulty chewing and swallowing.
Some foods should be limited in the patient's diet:
Citrus fruits: Oranges, lemons, grapefruits, tangerines, kumquats... contain a lot of acid, easily causing sore throat. In addition, other sour fruits such as strawberries, pineapples, green mangoes... are also not suitable for patients.; Foods that are dry, difficult to swallow, and difficult to digest such as sticky rice, nuts, whole grains... because they will make it difficult for the patient to swallow and digest food.; Processed foods, baked goods, fried foods, smoked meats/fish... They not only have little nutritional value but also contain many active ingredients that are not beneficial for the treatment process.; Food that is too hot or too cold will directly affect the throat area, causing the patient discomfort and pain; Drinks containing caffeine such as coffee, cappuccino, latte...; Beer, wine and alcoholic beverages.
